item.title: Ticket #108 (I get an XML Parsing Error whenever i got to my journals rss feeds) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Patch for that bug:

sh-2.05b# diff --rcs wp-rss2.php wp-rss2.php.patched d12 2 a13 1 echo '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="' . $charset . '"?'.'>'; ?>

This occurs in several of the xml generating files.

item.title: Ticket #154 (Can't future date a draft) updated
item.dc:creator: rmanalan
item.description:
1. Create Draft.
  2. Pull up draft to edit and set date into future.
  3. Save again as draft.
  4. View draft, and date has not been set in future.

item.title: Ticket #154 (Can't future date a draft) created
item.dc:creator: rmanalan
item.description: I've been trying to future date a draft post but it doesn't work (even with the Edit Timestamp checkbox checked). Seems like a bug to me.

item.title: Ticket #153 (Option to choose language of the post you want to read) created
item.dc:creator: kesla
item.description:
The idea is that as a blog-reader you don't wanna see a lot of messeges in some language that you don't know. Therefore would it be really good if you could choose what language the posts you want to read should have. This could easiest be done by making one more $_GET-variable called lang or something like this. Then when you write your message you also decide what language you are writing in.

I have the skills to make this feature alive myself but I wanna know from the developers (and community) if this is something that you think would be a good idea.

If you didn't quite get what I mean please comment. English is not my primary language.

Cheers

item.title: Ticket #152 (Bug in wp-include/functions.php) created
item.dc:creator: lstelie
item.description:
Current index.php returns :

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /MY_INSTALL_DIR/wp-includes/functions.php on line 1740

This line is :

foreach ($dogs as $catt) {

$category_cache[$catt->ID][] = $catt;

}

item.title: Changeset [1457]: De-funkify the CSS file.

item.description: De-funkify the CSS file.

item.title: Ticket #151 (Login fails) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: logging in fails for unknown reason. This is a problem discussed at length in the forums; many people have had logins mysteriously stop working (even when no changes have been made). Sometimes manually resetting the password using phpMyAdmin works, sometimes clearing cookies works, but not always.
